revised_title: An Account of the Rainfall Patterns in Upminster, Essex, Over 18 Years and a Comparison with Paris
tldr: The author, W. Derham, analyzes the rainfall patterns in Upminster, Essex, over 18 years and compares it with the data from Paris. He observes a remarkably dry year in 1714, with only 11 inches of rainfall, and discusses the potential effects of drought on animal health and human diseases.
